channel.title: [317 PI] Making NPC'S un-agressive? / Making NPC's clip?
channel.description:
Hey Mopar,
For my new training spot where people can shoot npc's from a wall with ranged, I want npc's not to attack back and just stay where they spawn. My problem is when I add the tiles to WalkingCheck.java (read which tiles below), the NPC and the user still just walk over it soon as you attack the npc...
Here's what I mean.
[url=http://postimg.org/image/gqnkaztbb/]http://postimg.org/image/gqnkaztbb/[/url]
What I want:
When I attack the NPC with ranged / magic, I want myself to stay where I am and I want the NPC to stay at it's spawn spot not trying to attack back. As you see at moment I just walk at the NPC and the NPC follows me and attacks back. I added coords of the row of tiles in front of the NPC's and added coords of the row of tiles next to the wall. I also tried adding invisible objects (object ID 0) to the same coords as I put in WalkingCheck.java, but it still did what the image above shows.
Is there any way to fix this?
By the way: When you're on the wall it's the same Height as on the ground where the NPC's are.
Greetings and thanks for reading!

item.title: [317 PI] Making NPC'S un-agressive? / Making NPC's clip?
item.dc:creator: @Java-RSPS-Noob Java-RSPS-Noob
item.description:
@Java-RSPS-Noob wrote:

[quote=“mthijs3, post:3, topic:525149”][quote author=Java-RSPS-Noob link=topic=643840.msg4333416#msg4333416 date=1373986303]
as long as you have object clipping this shouldn’t even be an issue. there are several guides out there

Do:

http://pastebin.com/A9CbYZ2r

then:

http://www.rune-server.org/runescape-development/google/tutorials/386960-pi-npc-clipping.html

then:

http://www.rune-server.org/runescape-development/google/snippets/387347-pi-clipped-npc-walking.html
[/quote]

Downloads are outdated on the first page ;l thanks though[/quote]can easily download any pi with region clipping and just c/p the folder

Read full topic
item.source: [317 PI] Making NPC'S un-agressive? / Making NPC's clip?

Hey Mopar,
